alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 9:49AM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 feet, with locally higher amounts on west and southwest slopes. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. Based on latest guidance, the heaviest snow will occur this afternoon and evening, with a lull in the activity late tonight and tomorrow morning. The snow will then become very heavy again Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning. The most intense winds will occur from late Tuesday night until Wednesday evening. * WHERE...The Upper Rio Grande Valley and the eastern San Juan Mountains. * WHEN...Through 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely dangerous if not impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. White-out conditions appear imminent, especially on Wednesday. Blow-downs of trees are likely.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
